column4: I have an issue trying to get my usb wireless adapter (linksys WUSB54GSCv2) to work with ndiswrapper. I have followed all the instructions I could find and I still cannot get it to work
what errors are you getting
what are you using 64bit or 32bit
what do you get with ndiswrapper -l
maybe if you retry using ndiswrapper -r name.inf and redo it.but you also need to blacklist any modules that are being loaded that are not being used.
that ndiswrapper -r nameofwindowsdriver without the inf on the end
i'll do that now
then reinstall with ndiswrapper name.inf  but also do ndiswrapper -ma too
what version ndiswrapper are you using ? dpkg -l|grep ndiswrapper
will do as soon as it comes back up... rebooted
i used 1.54 for my belkin N wireless adapter and it worked fine.
ndisgtk 0.8.4-1    ndiswrapper-common 1.54-2ubuntu1  ndiswrapper-utils-1.9    1.54-2ubuntu1
ok
was the blacklisting i did correct?
if so, can i go ahead and ndiswrapper -i <inf file>
well you can do lsmod and see if any wireless modules are loaded other than yours
it is showing ndiswrapper on that list
ndisgtk works too.
you need to be in the same folder as the above .inf and .sys files
well you can just mv it to a filename.conf
just mv /etc/modprobe.d/ndiswrapper /etc/modprobe.d/ndiswrapper.conf
